New Records: James Harden moved into second place on the NBA's career 3-point list with 2,874 made shots, surpassing Ray Allen's 2,973.
Key Match Events: Harden's first-quarter 3-pointer moved him past Allen, contributing to a 10-3 run and a 22-13 lead for the Clippers.
Pre-Game Insights: The Clippers led 66-45 at halftime and weathered a late run by the Jazz, who pulled within seven points with 3:18 remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: The Clippers ended a three-game losing streak and extended their winning streak in the new Intuit Dome.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mo Bamba made his Clippers debut after opening the season with a left knee soreness, scoring nine points with eight rebounds in 15 minutes.
Others: The Jazz are 0-2 on a four-game trip, while the Clippers have a four-game winning streak in their new building.
